title: "I fear not the man who has played a thousand champions once...
body: ...I fear the man who has played one champion a thousand times." - {{champion:64}}

replies.body:
These are pretty much all the good champs when mastered.
Not when picked up.
And it's my opinion.

**Troubles Of High Skill cap**
 * Are revolved around drastic nerfs*
{{champion:268}} Hush Miyra, I am dormant... They've no need to know.
{{champion:40}} *Awake but been sleeping since an eternity ago.* They really don't need to know, I'm sure it's ok if we don't tell them. 
{{champion:157}} You say it like it were simple
{{champion:163}} You haven't seen the worst of it...

{{champion:67}} They still can't touch what they can't see.
{{champion:238}} The Unseen enemy (ban) is the deadliest...
{{champion:136}} Unless it's the size of a mere human.
{{champion:114}} Remember where you place your words, like your head, mongrel.
{{champion:429}} Behind every damned fate there was a misdeed, the betrayed know this well.
{{champion:203}} As it is now Lamb we'll fade... No Wolf, we'll first wither, hunger, dim, flicker, thirst then... **starve**... Untill we're non-existant.

If it wasn't accurate I hope it was a fun read.

The idea Ekko isnt on here is ridiculous.

{{champion:240}} Isnt on there because no one can master Kled! He only can master himself.

Hell yeah! Every champ! I honestly appreciate this greatly cause when people talk about 'noob' champs it's like, these 'noob' champs require better game knowledge *usually*. Obv, everybody needs game knowledge but if your annie flash ults just a malphite you're prolly gonna lose that fight.
{{champion:19}}
yo uh... uhhh, gotta get the perfect... build? Yeah, perfect build.
Ive been surprised by good warwicks before actually. Like wait what? How does something with no mechanics outplay?
the ult isnt just cc, it also heals him quite a bit, so maybe it could be used for somethings

Warwick is all about macro, game vision, decision making and the skill to be at the right place at the right moment. That's why a good warwick will ramp up to 60% winrate when an average one has around 50%.
i have a 70% with ww, with 23 games played
keep this winrate on 200+ games and you are the best warwick World.

{{champion:240}} isn't on the list, because only **Skarl** can master Kled.

DUH!
http://i2.kym-cdn.com/entries/icons/original/000/017/225/zAp2LzJ.jpg

http://i1.kym-cdn.com/photos/images/newsfeed/000/589/673/fb9.gif

Sorta... what the hell Skarl is anyway?
A wind spirit. Not kidding.
I thought he was a Drakolops
They are wind spirits.
Not gonna say I don't believe you, but I don't remember seeing that. Sauce?

http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/story-art/XIABY305-if-skaarl-the-drakalops-is-a-wind-spirit-perhaps-willump-the-yeti-is-an-ice-spirit

It has a quote from the Q&A
Thanks man :D

And I'm a little effing princess.

I'm also pretty sure that the word "spirit" refers to non-corporeal beings.
Being a cowardly lizard ain't very _spiritual_.
They're elemental spirits.  And Yordles are considered spirits as well.

I know what Riot said, but I still call this a bullshit.

Especially that part about Yordles.
Ok...it's fine to have a different opinion but that doesn't change what they are.
I mean, Yordles were supposed to be descendants of a spacefaring race, not some immortal fairies.

And originally Yordles were all furry creatures and meglings were a different race of blue people. Then they got retconned into one race. 

They've changed a bunch. Now they're a form of fae race.

>Then they got retconned into one race.

Tristana was the only champion released as a megling.
After that "Meglings" were yordles being a part of the Megling Commando, the Bandle City Special Force.
Yeah, AKA they got retconned.
{{champion:19}} ?
So knowing when to ult, keeping track of enemy stun CDs etc. isnt something you learn?

The issue is that the second part isn't WW specific.  That is a general skill, therefore some who mastered any champion will be just as good at the skill.  

WW ult also isn't very situational.  There is a bit of difference between a WW player and someone with equal experience but on a different champion, but compared to most other champions it isn't much.

You basically use it in the same way you use any other CC ability, and so long as you do that you will function at about 80-90% of the efficiency of a WW player skill wise.

---------------------

In the end most champ mastery is knowing how far you can push your champion.  How much damage they take and deal, knowing your cd's without having to watch them.  That is really what separates good and bad players on simpler champions.

Just putting it out there.
There are more to your list, but Master Yi doesn't belong there tbh. When mastered, Yi just becomes a Yasuo with more DPS but no CC and windwall.
The better choice would be to remove yi and add someone like Bard
Idk about bard, I'd add khazix
I'd say Bard is high skill cap. He has some of the highest outplay of any supports I'd say.

> If it wasn't accurate I hope it was a fun read.

Did you just say Janna takes skill?

To play Janna at a basic level of skill is easy.

But her potential to completely outplay an enemy team with Monsoon is outrageous, as well as her ability to **completely and totally** destroy her own team's teamfight if she uses it improperly. I think this is what he's referring to.

Shyvana has the fourth highest win potential when played to her maximum according to RoadToMastery and has an extremely sharp learning curve according to stat tracker sites like champion.gg

Mastery is not only about mechanics.

Yes
{{champion:157}} As you can see i haven't done my research.

My extent of knowledge ends at exact numbers, in general(math >.<).
But yeah i do get you. Mechanics alone doesn't show the entire skill cieling of a champ alone, like old akali for example.
Pretty ok for newbs, but then i saw her winrate... 58% from '125+gamesplayed' on Akali mains, like damn. 
I'm not saying Akali is  for  'the brain-dead' type 'o champ. Just saying that mastering her mechanics won't get anyone thaaaat far.

{{champion:80}} Not mechanically intensive yet highly dangerous in the right hands.
what about someone who plays a 1000 champions 1000 times?

I once laned against a guy who played only {{champion:9}}.
Like after 3 season he had over 2000 ranked games on Fiddle.

He couldn't play for shit.

once played against a guy who spammed only fiora and had a win rate of 1%.
3 wins, 500 losses. I think they were a bot TBH.

> [{quoted}](name=Marshbouy,realm=NA,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=y59NwY2g,comment-id=00060000,timestamp=2016-11-20T15:12:43.255+0000)

> 3 wins, 500 losses. I think they were a bot TBH.

that's an obvious lie bro. They would get carried more than 3 times or the enemy team would have an afk to balance out. downvoted
I'm not lying. This guy intent fed almost every game. I'm 99% sure it was a bot.
then how the fuck had he not been banned at that point? lmao...

Because you can only get banned for being negative in the chat.

Bots and most feeders simply don't use the chat.
There are no bots on EUNE, though.
Its because Fiddle is severly underpowered besides his fear. He cant jungle anymore and he sucks in lane except support fiddle which isnt the best pick aswell.

But I would still rather run into a Jack of all trade than a Master of one in blind pick. Like really you can ONLY play mid/top with X champ. No back up champ, flexibility to be in another role? Something for when you don't get your role.

I would always chose the one who is competent in many role over the one who can only succeed in one role because they probably won't get their desired role.
